Keywords: Asgardian , Deity , Fantastic Four
Real Name: Johnny Storm
Special Powers
MOVEMENT: Destroy Blocking
TARGETING: Destroy Blocking
THE ETERNAL FLAME OF DESTRUCTION: Human Torch deals penetrating damage. // FREE: Choose a debris marker within range. Opposing characters occupying or adjacent to the marker are dealt 1 damage.
BURNING UP!: Poison, but deals damage even if moved or placed this turn.

Comments
March 5, 2022
Sylpharium
Really fun to play with Exospex or Goblin Glider. Hypersonic through a pack of enemies for the poison, blow up a couple blocking squares, then finish it with a close attack and his debris damage. If everything lines up he's doing crazy damage every turn.
March 4, 2022
hoojeebo
By my count, 4 are made up: Dr. Strange, Human Torch, Rocket Raccoon, and She-Hulk. Black Widow is from an issue of What If?, Iron Man is in his Cold Iron armor from a storyline in 2014 where he took on Malekith, Spider-Man is from a SM/Wolverine mini written by Jason Aaron from 2010, and Venom is *gasp* actually from the War of the Realms storyline.
March 4, 2022
pokolo
yes this version has not appeared in comics but is a heroclix own design... most of the chases of this set got this same treatment as the SVC chases i believe
March 4, 2022
Bobcat2022
The “Significant Appearance” on his card is listed as “Marvel HeroClix: Avengers War of the Realms (2021).” What does that mean—did this version of Johnny not appear in the comics? (Or is this some kind of forced joke about “flame wars” here on the “realms”?)
February 16, 2022
tidge
After a few years with enough low-cost Human Torch varieties to meet all your needs, we get a 100-point version that will need to produce offense. It certainly can do just that (with all the tricks), with the obvious risk being the lack of damage reducers. There are plenty of shared keyword friends and items that can assist on that score. I particularly like the top-dial 4 damage with 2 targets. This figure also Destroys Blocking as part of IMPROVED MOVEMENT, so a 'plink' attack is not really necessary to generate debris. Mary Jane may have him on speed-dial.
January 18, 2022
Hellboy the Bellboy
@Goop He has Improved Targeting: Blocking so that extra plink is easier to pull off, but yes opposing characters would have to be adjacent to that square.
January 18, 2022
Goop
I mostly like him for his traited pen damage and his great stats. I dont think the debris marker stuff will really see a lot of play, its pretty easily avoided and very dependent on the map you have and if you have something you can shoot through. Probably a better play is to use a cheaper figure to go around blowing up tons of walls and stuff to get the markers out so you dont have to try and do it with him. Still though i suspect he got the chase treatment because of his awesome sculpt and not his dial.
January 15, 2022
Hellboy the Bellboy
@DatHomieSilverSurfer not a free barrier. Using an already existing debris marker. Which due to his Improved Targeting: Destroy Blocking shouldn't be too difficult to pull off.
January 15, 2022
DatHomieSilverSurfer
So in one turn he can: Hit for 4 penetrating Deal 1 penetrating poison And use his free barrier for another 1 penetrating (which he can do every turn!) Amazing
January 15, 2022
Hellboy the Bellboy
Love him. Shoot someone through a wall and an extra plink from the newly created debris. Also a big fan of being able to Poison after movement/ placement.
